adm:managed-object.name: connection-handler
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis: are responsible for handling all interaction with the clients, including accepting the connections, reading requests, and sending responses.

adm:property.name: java-class
adm:property.adm:synopsis:
Specifies the fully-qualified name of the Java class that provides the
implementation.

adm:property.name: allowed-client
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies a set of address masks that determines the addresses of the clients that are allowed to establish connections to this connection handler.

adm:none.adm:synopsis: Changes to this configuration attribute take effect immediately and do not interfere with connections that may have already been established.

adm:alias.adm:synopsis: All clients with addresses that do not match an address on the deny list are allowed. If there is no deny list, then all clients are allowed.

adm:property.name: denied-client
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies a set of address masks that determines the addresses of the clients that are not allowed to establish connections to this connection handler.
adm:property.adm:description: If both allowed and denied client masks are defined and a client connection matches one or more masks in both lists, then the connection is denied. If only a denied list is specified, then any client not matching a mask in that list is allowed.

adm:none.adm:synopsis: Changes to this configuration attribute take effect immediately and do not interfere with connections that may have already been established.

adm:alias.adm:synopsis: If an allow list is specified, then only clients with addresses on the allow list are allowed. Otherwise, all clients are allowed.
